clinical_study.brief_title: Medicinal Nicotine for Preventing Stress Induced Craving and Withdrawal Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Medicinal Nicotine for Preventing Stress Induced Craving and Withdrawal Symptoms

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the timeframe (relative to a stress task) that is most effective at attenuating the increase in symptoms of tobacco craving and withdrawal that occur when smokers are presented with stressful situations.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 1 hour period after exposure to stressful task
primary_outcome.description: The craving increase that occurs when smokers are exposed to a stressful task will be measured

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 1 hour period after exposure to stressful task
secondary_outcome.description: The increase in nicotine withdrawal symptoms that occurs when smokers are exposed to a stressful task will be measured

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nicotine lozenge prior to stress task
arm_group.description: Subjects will receive the nicotine lozenge at one of four time-points prior to the stress task at the first laboratory session and after the stress task at the second laboratory session
Subjects will receive the nicotine lozenge after the stress task during the first laboratory session and prior to the stress task at the second laboratory session

intervention.description: A single dose of nicotine lozenge will be given at various timepoints relative to completion of a somewhat stressful task
intervention.arm_group_label: Nicotine lozenge prior to stress task

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Smoking an average of at least 10 cigarette per day
- General good health
Exclusion Criteria:
- unstable medical or psychiatric conditions
- history of severe motion sickness
- women who are pregnant or breast feeding
The investigators will evaluate if there are other reasons why someone may not participate
